name: Spectres
description:
Spectres is a Pac-Man styled game in which the payer takes on the role of Eddie who's job description probably says he's a 'Maze Maintenance worker.'

Eddie is an electrician. His job is to replace all the light bulbs in a maze, a maze that's naturally enough populated by ghosts. As the player / Eddie walks around the maze they leave a trail of light bulbs behind them. When Eddie reaches a generator all light bulbs currently placed will light up, this makes any ghosts in the lit areas vulnerable. However, when the generator burns out it disappears and takes all the bulbs with it.

When a ghost catches Eddie it takes him to the centre of the maze where there's a pen with an electrified fence. Eddie enters, a life is lost, and providing there are lives left, the game resumes with all previously placed light bulbs still in position.

Points are scored for light bulbs placed and ghosts captured.

shot.caption: This screen is displayed after the game has loaded
When the player presses a key the game displays a pretty pattern which disappears to slowly reveal the maze.
The start of a very short game. Eddie's about to get caught while I struggled to remember the action keys
The lights linked to the generator have lit up
Now the generator has gone and has taken the lights with it. No ghosts affected or caught this time
More lights laid but Eddie's been caught by the red ghost. He'll now wander back to the cell in the middle of the screen
Most of the maze is lit up this time. Shame they'll all go when the generator blows. Eddie's hiding behind the generator in the lower right corner
End of the game. There's no high score table, though the current score, 224, will replace the previous high score, 94, at the top of the screen for the next game
First there was light, and then darkness came upon us... or it was the opposite? Dunno...
Our player is dropping bulbs on the way. And there are cameras spread on each corner of the screen. Temporarily they'll illuminate the path you made...
But each time you use the cameras, the dropped bulbs are removed and you have to roam again. Here, every camera was used and all of the path was filled with bulbs. The border in red indicates that.
To finish the level, like in Superman 2, the player enters the Spectres chamber, bombarding  the outside with light turning the apparitions into inoffensive Caspers.
Sometimes the game tricks you, and suddenly another camera appears in the screen, toileting your previous efforts.
By the way, there are also portals in this game.
Almost finishing level 3. "Almost" (notice the preoccupation not to spoil the end of the game)
